story.title: TIF2TTOM - Move relationship features to the complex table.

ul.li: In GDF, relationships and complex features are quite similar.
In GDF, maneuvers are being modelled as relationships, while in TTOM, they are being modelled as complex features.
This leads to anomalies in the GDF dataloader code.
It is not possible to simply translate GDF relations into TTOM associations.
Moving the GDF relationship features that are not pure TTOM associations to the GDF complex table, could simplify the GDF dataloader code a lot.

slide.h5: The following features where moved from relationship to complex.

ul.li: Prohibited Maneuver, Priority Maneuver, Implicit Turn, Prohibited U Turn Maneuver, Restricted Maneuver, Calculated Prohibited Maneuver
Bifurcation, Signpost Information, Lane Connectivity, Image Maneuver

header.h4: Validation results: Relation table no longer has complex features
validation results: Relation features are modelled as complex
